title: Chat Restricted for no Reason?
body:
I was in a game recently, and the only thing I can think of was me saying "I swear to f**king christ" in reference to my disbelief that Kassadin barely survived Cassio poison after getting a kill. Then ally Lulu and Ashe rage quit after dying, and Lulu sits in fountain and Ashe Dc's. Lulu starts saying open mid or she will report us for trolling and wasting time. 
Game ends, we all presumably get reported, and I get a 10 chat restriction, and my honor goes down from 2/3 at lv 3, to Locked. 
Considering the context, that all I did was use a curse word in a POSITIVE manner, in only ONE single game, I was wondering if this is a possible fault of the chat filter system, and if it could be fixed? 

https://snag.gy/jvEoTe.jpg

https://streamable.com/c27jo
^ proof that it was only 1 curse word, I was not being toxic, and it was only 1 game

The game doesn't give two shits if you swear, as long as you're not trying to break the filter.

I don't mean just the person who left; I mean every one of your teammates (and the enemy team, if you said it in all chat) doesn't need to see that in chat. And if literally everyone on your team (or both, if in all chat) was disconnected, there would've been no purpose to even use chat at all, so there must've been someone there to see your chat messages.

It is harassment, it is unnecessary, and it is not acceptable. You are wrong. Your chat was inappropriate, and you have been punished for it. If you continue to insist that your behavior was good and demonstrate such behavior again, you will continue to receive punishments up to and including a permaban. So, learn from this and maintain your account, or don't. It's up to you.

Few things to throw out. There are repercussions to making a false police call, while in League there are none for a false report. The Police also need to treat each call as if it is true. In League this happens as well but gets divided up, because a report flags the game for review. Depending on the flag, it goes through different systems. Again, the system is designed so 1 report does the same as multiple so premades don't have power over non premades. (Outside of surrender voting).

One system, the IFS, usually handles the verbal components. This is a quick handler due to the ease of being able to check logs with an automated system.

The other system, Feederbuster (handles griefing in general), most likely checks for more obvious forms of trolling/feeding. If it fails to find anything, it gets forwarded for manual review. This system is most likely backlogged much like the Tribunal was back in the day. This is due to False reports by people who think a 0/3 top is inting when they are just being dominated. 

So, while it may seem like 9 people calling increases the odds the bank is being robbed; it doesn't make it certain. No matter what, the police will still respond as if it is true. Just as they would with 1 person calling.

For Red clarity.
